titles.title: Furusato Meguri Nippon no Mukashibanashi
Folktales from Japan Season 2
ふるさとめぐり 日本の昔ばなし
Hometown Visiting: Folktales from Japan
故乡漫游 日本的古老传说

anime.description: Like in any culture, Japanese kids grow up listening to the stories repeatedly told by their parents and grandparents. The boy born from a peach; the princess from the moon who is discovered inside a bamboo; the old man who can make a dead cherry tree blossom, etc. These short stories that teach kids to see both the dark and bright sides of life have passed traditional moral values from generation to generation. Source: crunchyroll

externalentity.identifier: ふるさとめぐり_日本の昔ばなし

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: mythology
tag.description: The anime gets inspirations from many forms of mythologies (either Greek, Egyptian, Nord, etc.) to form its story and setting.

tag.name: folklore
tag.description: Folklore, or simply Lore, are the traditions of a culture, subculture, or group, in the form of legends, music, proverbs, jokes, popular beliefs, fairy tales, stories, tall tales and customs. In usage, there is a continuum between folklore and mythology. Folklore is generally divided into four areas of study: physical artifacts, transmissible entities and stories, culture and technologies, and behaviors and rituals. [From Wikipedia]

tag.name: Japanese mythology
tag.description: Japanese mythology is a system of beliefs that embraces Shinto and Buddhist traditions as well as agriculture-based folk religion. The Shinto pantheon alone consists of an uncountable number of kami (Japanese for "gods" or "spirits"). (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: かっぱ石 / 阿寒湖のマリモ
Kappa Stone / The Moss Ball of Akan Lake
Kappa Ishi / Akanko no Marimo
episode.summary: A boy throws a rock at a baby kappa, and its father puts a powerful curse on him. The lake moss of the Ainu come to be refered as the heart of the forest. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: なまず神 / 伊能忠敬
The Catfish God / Inou Tadataka
Namazugami / Inou Tadataka
episode.summary: A wife unwittingly offends a powerful catfish god. Inou Tadataka becomes the first man to make a map of Japan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 竹の子童子 / 壱岐の島の鬼凧[おんだこ]
The Bamboo Shoot Child / The Demon Kite of Ikinoshima
Take no Ko Douji / Ikinoshima no Ondako
episode.summary: A child appears from inside a stalk of bamboo. A village makes a kite with the face of an oni. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 石になった鮫浦太郎 / 幸吉・空を飛ぶ
Sameuratarou Became a Rock / Koukichi Flies Through the Sky
Ishi ni Natta Samenoura Tarou / Koukichi: Sora o Tobu
episode.summary: A whale turns into a rock. A man wants to learn to fly, but runs into resistance from the Japanese government. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending
Opening
あこやの松 / 肥後のからしれんこん
The Akoya Pine / The Spicy Lotus Root of Higo
Akoya no Matsu / Higo no Karashi Renkon
episode.summary: A girl falls in love with the spirit of a pine tree. A frail lord is tempted into eating more by the power of mustard and lotus root. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おりん婆ととっくり岩 / マダラ鬼神と観音さま
Granny Orin and the Bottle Rock / The Madara Demon God and Kannon-sama
Orin Baa to Tokkuri Iwa / Madara Kishin to Kannon-sama
episode.summary: An old woman sacrifices herself to bring prosperity to a starving village. A demon god repairs a destroyed temple. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 安寿と厨子王 / とんちの吉四六さん
Anju and Zushiou / Kicchomu-san the Sharp
Anju to Zushiou / Tonchi no Kicchomu-san
episode.summary: A brother and sister escape from enslavement. Stories are told of Kicchomu, who is famous for his cleverness. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 狩人と鬼 / 浅草・三社祭
The Hunter and the Oni / The Three Shrine Festival of Asakusa
Kariudo to Oni / Asakusa Sanja Matsuri
episode.summary: A hunter outwits a giant ogre called an oni. Two sons find a statue of one of the buddhas while trying to catch fish for their sick mother. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 道灌 / 円空上人
Doukan / Priest Enkuu
Doukan / Enkuu-shounin
episode.summary: A peasant hears about Japanese poetry and decides to try some for himself. A monk whittles 100,000 statues of buddha. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オオカミ長者 / 鍾馗さんと鬼瓦
The Wolf Rich Man / Shouki-san and the Demon Roof Tile
Ookami Chouja / Shouki-san to Onigawara
episode.summary: A man gains the ability to see others for the animals they really are. A demon roof tile brings misfortune. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 金のしゃくし / チャグチャグ馬コ
The Golden Ladle / The Chaguchagu Pony
Kin no Shakushi / Chaguchagu Umakko
episode.summary: An ogre possesses a golden ladle. A young boy`s beloved horse is brutally treated by a rich man. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 相撲をとった力石 / 奈良の大仏
Chikaraishi Plays Sumo / The Great Buddha of Nara
Sumou o Totta Chikara Ishi / Nara no Daibutsu
episode.summary: A man named Chikaraishi battles Kappa for sumo supremacy. The great buddha of Nara is built over a period of decades. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ほうこさん / 侘茶と千利休
Houko-san / Wabicha and Senno Rikyuu
Houko-san / Wabicha to Sennorikyuu
episode.summary: A girl sacrifices herself to save her master`s daughter. Sen Rikyuu creates a new style of tea. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とうふ地蔵 / 平賀源内
The Tofu Priest Statue / Hiraga Gennai
Toufu Jizou / Hiraga Gennai
episode.summary: A greedy man wants to cheat customers out of tofu. A lowly merchant grows to great riches. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 麦わら大蛇 / なせばなる上杉鷹山
The Giant Barley Straw Snake / Uesugi Youzan Makes It Work
Mugiwara Daija / Naseba Naru Uesugi Youzan
episode.summary: A snake made of straw comes to life. Uesugi Youzan makes things happen. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幽霊にもらった力こぶ / 八丁先のうまい味噌
The Beefy Biceps Given by a Ghost / The Yummy Miso That`s a Hacchou Away
Yuurei ni Moratta Chikara Kobu / Hacchousaki no Umai Miso
episode.summary: A ghost makes a man strong. Good miso is found only a short distance away. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 久米仙人の話 / 月と仏とおらが蕎麦
A Story of Sage Kume / The Moon, the Buddha, and My Soba
Kume Sennin no Hanashi / Tsuki to Hotoke to Ora ga Soba
episode.summary: A man wants to be a Sennin but fails, so he becomes a salesman instead. Kobayashi Issa, the haiku poet, thinks of the sun, the moon, and his soba. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鬼がくれた力 / おけいのおけさ節
The Power Given by an Ogre / The Okesabushi of Okei
Oni ga Kureta Chikara / Okei no Okesabushi
episode.summary: An oni gives a girl great power. A cat of repays the kindness of its owners. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おへんどさんとおふろ / 姫路城のもののけ退治
The Pilgrim and the Bath / The Slaying of the Monster of Himeji Castle
Ohendo-san to Ofuro / Himeji Jou no Mononoke Taiji
episode.summary: A man gets a bathtub stuck to his butt by an angry god. A warrior challenges the ghosts of Himeji castle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: たぬき田 / 文左衛門のみかん船
Tanuki Fields / The Orange Boat of Bunzaemon
Tanuki Da / Bunzaemon no Mikanbune
episode.summary: Tanuki plow a field for a kind man. Bunzaemon becomes rich selling oranges. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忍者伊助とオオサンショウウオ / 柿の輝き有田焼
Ninja Isuke and the Oosanshouuo / Arita-yaki Shine Like Persimmons

episode.summary: A ninja learns secret techniques. New methods for pottery are divised. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゆめつげ地蔵 / 岩槻の人形
The Dream-Telling Priest Statue / The Iwatsuki Doll
Yumetsuge Jizou / Iwatuski no Ningyou
episode.summary: A priest statue gives warnings in dreams. A master dollmaker makes a doll from unique materials. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大黒さまと伝三郎長者 / たぬき和尚とけんちん汁
Daikoku-sama and Denzaburou the Rich Man / The Tanuki Priest and Kenchin Soup
Daikoku-sama to Denzaburou Chouja / Tanuki Oshou to Kenchinjiru
episode.summary: A lazy man becomes rich with the help of a god. A raccoon gathers donations for a temple. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お仙が淵 / 富山の薬売り
Osengafuchi / The Medicine-Seller of Toyama
Osengafuchi / Toyama no Kusuri Uri
episode.summary: A man falls in love with a carp he catches in a lake. A lord learns the ways of herbs. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴマまんじゅう / 道後温泉のはじまり
The Sesame Seed Manjuu / The Beginning of Dougo Hot Springs

episode.summary: A woman uses sesame seed buns to turn people into cows. The hot springs at dogo are discovered. Source: crunchyroll

The Rice-Spouting Priest Statue / The Dog Goes to Ise
Kome Dashi Jizou / Inu no Oisemairi
episode.summary: A priest statue spits out yummy rice. A dog goes to Ise. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オオカミ長者 / 幸吉・空を飛ぶ
The Wolf Rich Man / Koukichi Flies Through the Sky
Ookami Chouja / Koukichi: Sora o Tobu
宇佐の船[ふな]ゆうれい / 阿波の狸合戦
The Ship Ghosts of Usa / The Tanuki War of Awa
Usa no Funa Yuurei / Awa no Tanukigassen
episode.summary: A ship of ghosts tries to drag the living to the bottom of the ocean. Raccoons fight a war in Awa. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: びっきのよめさん / 近江商人
The Bikki Wife / The Oumi Merchant

episode.title: どっこい真壁の平四郎 / 富士山にたつ
Heishirou of Dokkoi Makabe / Standing on Mt. Fuji
Dokkoi Makabe no Heishirou / Fujisan ni Tatsu
episode.summary: A boy becomes high priest after a lowly upbringing. A girl becomes the first woman to stand on Mt. Fuji. Source: crunchyroll

The Priest and the Old Tanuki / Otane`s Lake
Oshou-san to Furudanuki / Otane no Ike
episode.summary: A priest becomes friends with an old raccoon. A beautiful woman called Otane meets a sad fate. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 目ん玉のいれかえ / 白虎隊
Eyeball Swapping / The Byakkotai

episode.summary: A man becomes a doctor after his eyeball falls out. In Aizu, the Byakkotai dies at the end of a war. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: せとものまつりの雨 / かかあ天下とお蚕さま

episode.summary: A god rides on a cucumber. A lord becomes rich using his abacus to keep expenses down. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大グマと弥次衛門 / 日光東照宮と左甚五郎

Wanting to Be Poor / The Blessings of Uzumi

episode.title: トンビになりたかった男 / 屋久島の山姫
The Man Who Wanted to Be a Black Kite / The Mountain Princess of Yakushima
Tonbi ni Naritakatta Otoko / Yakushima no Yamahime
episode.summary: A man wants to be a black kite. A sinister creature haunts a tree on a island. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: やまんばのもち / なまはげ
The Mountain Granny`s Mochi / Namahage
Yamanba no Mochi / Namahage
episode.summary: A mountain granny brings prosperity in exchange for delicious mochi. Horrible creatures called Namahage strike a town in Akita. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 屁ひり嫁 / 首里城の料理番
The Farting Wife / The Chef of Shuri Castle
He Hiri Yome / Shuri Jou no Ryouriban
episode.summary: A wife farts so hard that she blows down trees. A chef in Okinawa competes for the best dish. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おへんどさんとおふろ / おけいのおけさ節
The Pilgrim and the Bath / The Okesabushi of Okei
Ohendo-san to Ofuro / Okei no Okesabushi
隠形の男 / 四万十川のカワウソ
The Invisible Man / The River Otter of Shimanto River
Ongyou no Otoko / Shimantougawa no Kawauso
episode.summary: A man becomes invisible and feels very alone. A river otter is tricked by dastardly shrimp. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: わら束と武芸者 / 鯖街道の背負い人
The Swordsman and the Bale of Straw / The Pack Carriers of Mackerel Highway
Wara Taba to Bugeisha / Saba Kaidou no Seoibito
episode.summary: A samurai breaks a teacup owned by a poor man. Pack runners carry salmon along a mountain path. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 米つぶ三つぶ黄金三つぶ / 清水の次郎長
Three Grains of Rice, Three Grains of Gold / Jirochou of Shimizu
Kome Tsubu Mittsubu Ougon Mittsubu / Shimizu no Jirochou
episode.summary: Three grains of rice become three grains of gold. A man named Jirochou is an inpsiration to everyone. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 山伏ダヌキ / 錦帯橋の人形石
The Mountain Monk Tanuki / The Doll Stones of Kintai Bridge
Yamabushi Tanuki / Kintaikyou no Ningyou Ishi
episode.summary: A raccoon disguises itself as a mountain monk. A woman is sacrificed to make a bridge sturdy. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 紙ぶくろの風 / 七夕さんの贈りもの
The Paper Bag Wind / Tanabata-san`s Present
Kanbukuro no Kaze / Tanabata-san no Okurimono
episode.summary: A man bags the wind. An ancient legend about Tanabata is still told to this day. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: やまんば堂 / 菅原道真と飛梅伝説
Mountain Granny Shrine / Sugawara Michizane and the Legend of the Flying Plum
Yamanba Dou / Sugawara Michizane to Tobiume Densetsu
episode.summary: A mountain grannie repays those who are kind to her. A child prodigy is banished far from the capital. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地獄におちた坊さん / 食いしん坊な水戸光圀
The Monk Who Went to Hell / Mito Mitsukuni Is Hungry
Jogoku ni Ochita Bou-san / Kuishinbou na Mito Mitsukuni
episode.summary: A greedy priest is sent to hell. A great man named Mito Mitsukuni is very hungry. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絵からぬけでた子馬 / 冷や汁婆ちゃん
The Colt That Escaped from a Painting / The Cold Soup Granny
E kara Nukedeta Kouma / Hiyajiru Baa-chan
episode.summary: A horse from a painting comes alive. A recipe is made for cold soup. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 石堂丸 / 松江城とコノシロ
Ishidoumaru / Konoshiro and Matsue Castle
Ishidoumaru / Matsuejou to Konoshiro
episode.summary: A boy called Ishidoumaru searches for his father. A lord battles a monster in his keep. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 弥五郎どんと男たち / 津軽の虫おくり
Yagorou-don and the Men / The Bug-Sending of Tsugaru
Yagorou-don to Otoko-tachi / Tsugaru no Mushi Okuri
episode.summary: A giant called Yagorou-dono lived long ago. A god drives away insects from crops. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 北のお山の権現様 / 安珍と清姫
The Gongen-sama on the Northern Mountain / Anchin and Kiyohime
Kita no Oyama no Gongen-sama / Anchin to Kiyohime
episode.summary: A goddess lives on the northern mountain. Kiyohime becomes a snake and attacks the one she loves. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 十六日桜 / 猿橋
The 16th Day Cherry Tree / Monkey Bridge
Juurokunichizakura / Saru Hashi
episode.summary: A cherry tree blooms on the night of the full moon. A bridge-maker makes a bride over a steep canyon. Source: crunchyroll
